Authors:
M. Amalia Scataglini, Sandra S. Aliscioni, Fernando Omar
Zuloaga
Title:
On the taxonomic position of Panicum scabridum (Poaceae,
Panicoideae, Paspaleae)
Keywords:
Panicum scabridum, phylogeny, combined analysis,
anatomy
Abstract:
Panicum scabridum, an incertae sedis species of Panicum
s.l., is here included in the genus Coleataenia, following a
phylogenetic analysis based on one new ndhF sequence of the species and
associated morphological data. Panicum scabridum and species of
Coleataenia are cespitose and perennial plants, with a lower glume
(1â“)3â“5-nerved, 1/3 to 3/4 of the spikelet, upper glume and lower
lemma 5â“9-nerved, and upper anthecium smooth, shiny, and indurate.
Within Coleataenia, P. scabridum appeared as the sister taxon of the
species pair C. prionitis and C. petersonii; these three species are the
only NADP-me taxa of tribe Paspaleae exhibiting two bundle sheaths
around the vascular bundles, i.e., with an outer parenchymatous sheath
and a inner mestome sheath with specialized chloroplasts. The new
combination Coleataenia scabrida is proposed.
